introduction.content:
Welcome to Cuisinous!

By using our app or website, you agree to these Terms & Conditions. Please read them carefully.

purpose.title: 1. Purpose
purpose.content:
These T&C define the rules for using the Cuisinous platform, which connects:
‚Ä¢ Vendors (chefs) offering homemade meals,
‚Ä¢ and Customers looking to order such meals.

Cuisinous acts solely as a facilitator and does not cook or deliver meals.

registration.title: 2. Registration and Account
registration.content:
‚Ä¢ All users must create an account with a valid email and phone number.
‚Ä¢ Vendors must provide required documents for verification (ID, licenses, or certificates when applicable).
‚Ä¢ Users are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of their login credentials.

use.title: 3. Use of the Platform
use.content:
‚Ä¢ Customers can browse menus and order meals from local vendors.
‚Ä¢ Vendors post their offers, set their own prices, and are fully responsible for the quality and compliance of their meals.
‚Ä¢ All content (photos, descriptions) must be accurate and respectful.

payments.title: 4. Payments and Commissions
payments.content:
‚Ä¢ All payments are processed through the Cuisinous platform.
‚Ä¢ A 20% commission is charged on each transaction (covering service and operational fees).
‚Ä¢ Remaining funds are transferred to vendors after deductions.

responsibilities.title: 5. Responsibilities
responsibilities.content:
‚Ä¢ Vendors: must ensure hygiene, food safety, and compliance with local laws.
‚Ä¢ Customers: must use the platform legally and respectfully.
‚Ä¢ Cuisinous: acts as a technology intermediary and is not liable for the preparation, quality, or delivery of meals.

cancellations.title: 6. Cancellations and Refunds
cancellations.content:
‚Ä¢ Cancellation and refund policies are set by each vendor, subject to platform rules.
‚Ä¢ Cuisinous may intervene in disputes but does not guarantee refunds.

data.title: 7. Data Protection
data.content: Personal data is collected and processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

property.title: 8. Intellectual Property
property.content: All elements of the platform (logo, design, content) are the property of Cuisinous and may not be used without authorization.

suspension.title: 9. Suspension or Termination
suspension.content: Cuisinous may suspend or terminate an account in cases of fraud, rule violations, or inappropriate behavior.

law.title: 10. Governing Law
law.content: These T&C are governed by the laws of Qu√©bec and Canada.

introduction.content:
Your trust matters to us. We are committed to protecting your personal information and using it in a transparent and secure manner. This Privacy Policy explains in detail what data we collect, how it is used, how it is protected, and your rights.

By accessing our site or application, you agree to this Policy.

collect.title: 1. Information We Collect
collect.content:
We may collect the following categories:
‚Ä¢ Identification data: name, email, phone number, date of birth, ID documents.
‚Ä¢ Account data: vendor or customer status, login credentials.
‚Ä¢ Financial data: payment details, transaction history.
‚Ä¢ Geolocation data: to show available meals nearby.
‚Ä¢ User content: reviews, ratings, photos, menus, messages.
‚Ä¢ Technical data: IP address, device type, operating system, cookies.

purpose.title: 2. Purpose of Use
purpose.content:
Your information is used to:
‚Ä¢ Manage and verify your account.
‚Ä¢ Process orders, payments, and deliveries.
‚Ä¢ Improve our services (personalized recommendations, promotions).
‚Ä¢ Ensure security and prevent fraud.
‚Ä¢ Comply with legal obligations (tax, food safety, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Communicate updates, newsletters, and promotions (with your consent).

sharing.title: 3. Sharing of Information
sharing.content:
We never sell your personal data.

We may share it only with:
‚Ä¢ Payment providers to process transactions.
‚Ä¢ Delivery/logistics partners (if applicable).
‚Ä¢ Technical service providers (hosting, analytics, IT support).
‚Ä¢ Public authorities when legally required.

retention.title: 4. Data Retention
retention.content:
‚Ä¢ We retain your information as long as your account is active or as required by law (e.g., 7 years for financial data).
‚Ä¢ Inactive accounts may be deleted or anonymized after a reasonable period.

security.title: 5. Security
security.content: We apply administrative, technical, and physical safeguards (encryption, access control, backups). However, no system is fully secure, and we encourage strong password use.

rights.title: 6. Your Rights (Law 25 ‚Äì Qu√©bec & Canadian laws)
rights.content:
You have the right to:
‚Ä¢ Access your information.
‚Ä¢ Request correction or deletion.
‚Ä¢ Withdraw consent at any time (except where legally required).
‚Ä¢ Data portability, where applicable.
‚Ä¢ File a complaint with the Commission d'acc√®s √† l'information du Qu√©bec.

children.title: 7. Children's Data
children.content: Our service is not intended for individuals under 14. Minors aged 14‚Äì18 must have parental consent to register as vendors.

cookies.title: 8. Cookies
cookies.content:
We use cookies to:
‚Ä¢ Ensure the site works properly.
‚Ä¢ Analyze usage and improve experience.
‚Ä¢ Personalize promotions.

You can manage cookie preferences in your browser.

transfers.title: 9. International Transfers
transfers.content: If data is transferred outside Canada, it will be handled according to applicable privacy laws and protected by contractual safeguards.

updates.title: 10. Policy Updates
updates.content: We may update this Policy. The "last updated" date will always be displayed.

purpose.title: 1. Purpose
purpose.content: This agreement sets the terms under which the Vendor offers homemade meals through the Cuisinous platform.

vendorObligations.title: 2. Vendor's Obligations
vendorObligations.content:
The Vendor agrees to:
‚Ä¢ Prepare and sell meals in compliance with hygiene and food safety standards applicable in Qu√©bec.
‚Ä¢ Provide accurate information on ingredients, allergens, and prices.
‚Ä¢ Deliver or make meals available to customers within agreed timeframes.
‚Ä¢ Hold all required licenses, permits, and legal authorizations.
‚Ä¢ Maintain a respectful and professional attitude towards customers and the Platform.

cuisinousObligations.title: 3. Cuisinous' Obligations
cuisinousObligations.content:
Cuisinous agrees to:
‚Ä¢ Provide the Vendor with access to the platform to publish and sell meals.
‚Ä¢ Process payments and transfer net funds (after commissions and applicable fees) to the Vendor.
‚Ä¢ Provide reasonable technical support if needed.

commissions.title: 4. Commissions and Payments
commissions.content:
‚Ä¢ Each sale is subject to a 15% commission retained by Cuisinous.
‚Ä¢ Payment of the balance to the Vendor is made via bank transfer [e.g., weekly/monthly] as set by the platform.
‚Ä¢ Transaction and processing fees are deducted from the Vendor's payouts.

responsibilities.title: 5. Responsibilities
responsibilities.content:
‚Ä¢ The Vendor is solely responsible for the quality, preparation, and safety of the meals.
‚Ä¢ Cuisinous acts only as an intermediary and cannot be held liable for meals provided by the Vendor.

property.title: 6. Intellectual Property
property.content:
The Vendor retains ownership of their recipes and content.
However, the Vendor grants Cuisinous a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use photos and descriptions for promotion of the platform.

termination.title: 7. Term and Termination
termination.content:
‚Ä¢ This agreement becomes effective upon acceptance and remains in effect until terminated.
‚Ä¢ Either party may terminate with 15 days' written notice.
‚Ä¢ In case of serious breach (fraud, rule violations, repeated complaints), Cuisinous reserves the right to terminate immediately.

law.title: 8. Governing Law
law.content: This agreement is governed by the laws of Qu√©bec and Canada.

introduction.content: This policy explains the cancellation and refund conditions applicable to orders placed on our platform.

clientCancellation.title: 1. Cancellation by the Client
clientCancellation.content:
‚Ä¢ An order can be canceled within 15 minutes of confirmation for a full refund.
‚Ä¢ After this period, cancellation depends on the Vendor's (chef's) policy.
‚Ä¢ Orders already being prepared or ready for pickup/delivery are non-refundable.

vendorCancellation.title: 2. Cancellation by the Vendor (Chef)
vendorCancellation.content:
‚Ä¢ If a Vendor cancels an order (e.g. ingredient shortage, emergency), the Client will receive a full refund.
‚Ä¢ Refunds are issued automatically through the original payment method.

incorrectOrders.title: 3. Incorrect or Incomplete Orders
incorrectOrders.content:
‚Ä¢ If a Client receives a meal that does not match the order (wrong dish, missing item), they must contact Cuisinous within 24 hours.
‚Ä¢ After verification, a partial or full refund may be issued.

quality.title: 4. Quality and Allergies
quality.content:
‚Ä¢ Vendors are responsible for the quality and accuracy of meal descriptions.
‚Ä¢ Cuisinous cannot be held responsible for allergic reactions if the Client did not check the ingredients before ordering.
‚Ä¢ No refunds will be issued for undisclosed allergies.

timelines.title: 5. Refund Timelines
timelines.content: ‚Ä¢ Refunds are processed within 5 to 10 business days, depending on the payment method.

introduction.content: At Cuisinous, food safety and customer health are our top priorities. All Vendors (chefs or independent cooks) using the platform must comply with the following standards:

regulations.content:

o Obtaining any required certification or registration.

hygiene.title: 2. Hygiene and Preparation
hygiene.content:
‚Ä¢ Meals must be prepared in a clean and safe environment.
‚Ä¢ Utensils, surfaces, and equipment must be sanitized regularly.
‚Ä¢ Ingredients must be fresh and stored at appropriate temperatures.

allergies.title: 3. Allergies and Ingredient Information
allergies.content:

‚Ä¢ It is the Client's responsibility to check ingredients before ordering.
